medical_history.chief_complaint: Cough, weight loss, odynophagia, and failure to thrive.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in his usual state of health until approximately 15 months earlier, when an intermittent cough developed, leading to gradual weight loss. Seven months before admission, he lost his job, resulting in decreased oral intake, family noted depression, and increased sleep. Over the next 2 months, the cough increased and became productive of dark-yellow sputum. Weight loss was approximately 23 kg in the previous year, and he had episodes of dizziness and falling associated with hypoglycemia and dehydration.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes mellitus (for more than 20 years), hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, hyperlipidemia, thyroid nodules, pulmonary asbestosis (diagnosed with pleural plaques and pulmonary fibrosis from exposure to asbestos during work in a shipyard), and previous hospital admission for hypoglycemia.
medical_history.family_history: A son had died from lymphoma at 51 years of age.
medical_history.social_history: He lived with his wife, had a history of heavy smoking until his diabetes diagnosis, and reported no alcohol or illicit drug use. He worked in sales and had been born and raised in an urban area in Massachusetts.
